title.narrative: Technical Assistance Contracts - i) supporting program management, monitoring and evaluation ii) strenghtening data quality; iii) independent verification of results data; iv) implementation of behaviour change sanitation and hygiene campaign. v)

description.narrative: This activity (Technical Assistance Contracts - i) supporting program management, monitoring and evaluation ii) strenghtening data quality; iii) independent verification of results data; iv) implementation of behaviour change sanitation and hygiene campaign. v)) is a component of Support to Rural Water Supply, Sanitation & Hygiene in Tanzania reported by FCDO, with a funding type of 'Procurement of Services' and a budget of £14,812,807. This component benefits Tanzania, and works in the following sector(s): Basic drinking water supply, Basic sanitation. , with the following implementing partners: DAI Europe, Ecorys, London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine, London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, Oxford Policy Management. The start date is 05-05-2014 and the end date is 30-03-2022.

London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine
